title: Awe-Inspiring! Burj Khalifa Lit Up With The Face Of Bapu On Occasion Of Gandhi Jayanti
text:
Awe-Inspiring! Burj Khalifa Lit Up With The Face Of Bapu On Occasion Of Gandhi Jayanti

Awe-Inspiring! Burj Khalifa Lit Up With The Face Of Bapu On Occasion Of Gandhi Jayanti

Yesterday the country celebrated the 150th birth anniversary of bapu. Mahatma Gandhi's role in India's freedom struggle is known to all, young and old. So, it's no surprise that the world's tallest skyscraper honoured his memory in a special way too.

Burj Khalifa in Dubai was lit spectacularly in the colours of the tricolour and images of Mahatma Gandhi himself.

Dubai's Burj Khalifa lit up with Mahatma Gandhi's image on the occasion of his birth anniversary. (Video Courtesy: Consulate General of India, Dubai) #GandhiAt150 #GandhiJayanti pic.twitter.com/tOu9yKr4Ff — ANI (@ANI) October 2, 2019

The skyscraper had even honoured the father of the nation last year, on his 149th birth anniversary. It had displayed some of his most popular messages: ‘Be the change you wish to see in the world,’ ‘Non-violence is the virtue of the strong,’ ‘Poverty is the worst form of violence’.

Even Air India paid a tribute to Mahatma Gandhi in its own way by painting his portrait on the tail of an Airbus A320 aircraft at Indira Gandhi International Airport. The portrait seems very minimalistic, painted in white outline, portraying Bapu with his signature dandi (a representation of how he led the Dandi March) .

Air India pays tribute to Mahatma Gandhi by painting his portrait on the tail of an Airbus A320 aircraft at Indira Gandhi International Airport(Delhi) #GandhiJayanti #GandhiAt150 pic.twitter.com/JCEGeL4KPP — ANI (@ANI) October 2, 2019

Air India CMD Ashwani Lohani said, “This is the first time in India it has happened. This is our way to send a message of Gandhi Ji to the world. In future, one aircraft of each model of Air India aircraft fleet will have a portrait of Gandhi Ji on the aircraft tail.”

Mahatma Gandhi is known around the world for his belief in non-violence as a mode of protest and thoughts about self dependence and views of ‘swachchta’. That is one of the reasons why PM Modi wanted to declare India open-defecation free.
description: Yesterday the country celebrated the birth of the Father of the nation a believer of Ahimsa who played a pivotal role in the freedom struggle against British: Mahatma Gandhi. #gandhi jayanti was one of the topmost trending hashtag on Twitter today, also because it is the 150th anniversary of Bapu.
